result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:25 AM Defendant in court. Attorney Mark Fruehauff in court. Attorney Jake Gondik in Court. Attorney Gondik requests to witdraw. 
Court grants motion to withdraw. Court set dates.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Attorney's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

8:42 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Jaylon James Brown.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates motion to withdraw filed. Defendant has another matter for which Mr. Gondik has not yet been appointed. Asking for reset of prelim in that matter. Asks for status in this matter. 
in 22CF232 defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:42 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Jaylon James Brown.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney receives information, waives reading, not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas.

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Exhibits to Preliminary Hearing

8:43 AM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik in court for Jaylon James Brown.  Attorney Angela Wilson court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness. Witness sworn and testified. State direct exam. Officer Lauren Phillips. Officer just over a year. Friday March 18, 2022. Palace Bar, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Viewed video evidence. Knows defendant from school in Superior, also saw defendant earlier that night. Witness identifies Defendant.  Court notes identification of witness. Exhibits 1-4 marked and shown to witness, still photos from video footage of Palace Bar.  Ask for admission of exhibits. Objection as to foundation, overruled. Exhibits received. Witness testifies as to exhibits. Objection, speculation, overruled. 
Attorney Gondik cross examines witness. Objection, relevance, overruled. Witness indicates no bullet or gun recovered. 
Court questions witness regarding wall where bullet is lodged. 
State redirects. Witness steps down
State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Asks count 1 be amended to misdemeanor criminal damage to property. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of his bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Palace Bar. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon or firearms.
No contact with Palace Bar. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon or firearms.

2:19PM Defendant Jaylon James Brown in court with attorney Jacob Gondik.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for State of Wisconsin. Address verified as 1107 Clough Avenue, Superior WI. Attorney Gondik acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing. Court quashes warrant based on appearance.  State requests $5000 cash, conditions of no contact with Palace Bar, no alcohol, no firearms or other dangerous weapon. Cites one prior in 2015. 
Gondik indicates superior resident for 9 years, has child in superior, no criminal record, no missed court appearances. Cash not necessary. Asks for high signature bond. Could come up with 1,000.

Court orders $10,000 signature bond, 1,000 cash, with conditions of no contact with Palace Bar, no going to establishments who serve alcohol, no use or possession of alcohol, no use or possession of firearms or dangerous weapon.  Defendant waives time limits. Court finds knowingly and voluntarily waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.
